title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 December 2013 - XWiki
content:
<DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
00:43 <vmassol> has quit  
00:45 <lucaa> has quit  
00:51 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
01:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
01:43 <vmassol> has quit  
01:55 <Denis> has quit

03:45 <vmassol> has quit

04:44 <vmassol> has quit

05:59 <Denis> has quit  
06:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
06:46 <vmassol> has quit

07:07 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
07:24 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
07:24 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
07:55 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
08:05 <dpatriche> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:33 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:48 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:56 <tmortagne> vmassol: XWIKI-9766  
08:56 <tmortagne> "shouldn't" ?  
08:56 <vmassol> indeed :)  
08:57 <vmassol> thanks  
09:07 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:11 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:13 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <UCC> has quit  
09:33 <sburjan> vmassol, tmortagne: good morning. I am going to test http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9708 with the default upgrade option  
09:44 <vmassol> sburjan: ok cool  
09:45 <tmortagne> sburjan: thanks, XE-1347 would be cool too since that's the last remaining blocker for 5.2.2 with XWIKI-9753  
09:46 <sburjan> tmortagne: yepp, I am going to test that too  
09:47 <tmortagne> vmassol: do we really plan to fix it for 5.2.2 (I mean the PDF one), I see you only talk about 5.3 in your last comment  
09:49 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
09:51 <vmassol> tmortagne: we won't be able to fix it I believe  
09:52 <vmassol> so we need to choose which bug we want to have  
09:52 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <vmassol> ...  
09:52 <tmortagne> I did not really following this issue  
09:52 <tmortagne> \*followed  
09:52 <vmassol> you can read the comments  
09:52 <vmassol> marius fixed something (toc issue in PDf export)  
09:52 <vmassol> and caused a regression  
09:52 <vmassol> (SVG doesn't export anymore)  
09:53 <tmortagne> ok, I guess toc is more common than SVG  
09:53 <vmassol> well  
09:53 <vmassol> the issue says:  
09:53 <vmassol> "PDF Export doesn't list the Table of Contents under certain circumstances"  
09:53 <vmassol> need to read what are those circumstances  
09:53 <cjd> IMO PDF export is a white elephant  
09:53 <cjd> also good morning  
09:54 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <tmortagne> vmassol: one could still use his browser pdf printer/export at worst  
09:54 <vmassol> I also think that SVG is less important than TOC… The real fix should have kept jtidy to not cause other issues  
09:54 <vmassol> tmortagne: sure and they can use google docs if xwiki doesn't work too ;)  
09:55 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <tmortagne> vmassol: I don't see the point in this comparison, you can get pretty much the same result than what you get with XWiki PDF export only it will actually work  
09:56 <vmassol> the point is  
09:56 <vmassol> if we have a PDF export it's supposed to work  
09:56 <cjd> 09:54 <+tmortagne> vmassol: one could still use his browser pdf printer/export at worst <-- I think it was a significant mistake to have promised users that PDF export would work in XWiki rather than having educated them about browser print-to-file early on  
09:56 <vmassol> if not then we might as well remove it  
09:56 <tmortagne> I'm talking about 5.2.2 here  
09:56 <tmortagne> not XWiki in general  
09:56 <vmassol> i don't understand your point  
09:57 <vmassol> you can say the same thing for any bug  
09:57 <tmortagne> of course not  
09:57 <vmassol> give me one that doesn't work?  
09:57 <tmortagne> any XWiki specific stuff  
09:58 <vmassol> then don't use xwiki  
09:58 <vmassol> use google docs  
09:58 <vmassol> same  
09:58 <tmortagne> ...  
09:58 <vmassol> there are always workarounds  
09:58 <vmassol> anyway we both prefer SVG failing  
09:59 <vmassol> I guess we need to be sure sergiu is ok since he's using that apparently  
09:59 <vmassol> I'll ping him  
09:59 <vmassol> the other optiob is rollbacking  
09:59 <vmassol> maiurs change  
09:59 <vmassol> and look at fixing the issue using jtidy  
10:00 <vmassol> or does as I mentioned, ie package patch  
10:00 <vmassol> in XE  
10:00 <vmassol> \*do  
10:00 <tmortagne> we already use htmlcleaner so I have the same opinion than Marius  
10:00 <tmortagne> the best is to make it work with htmlcleaner  
10:00 <vmassol> that's not possible  
10:00 <vmassol> except with the pathc possivility  
10:00 <vmassol> because it won't be on maven central  
10:01 <tmortagne> it would not be the first time we patch htmlcleaner  
10:01 <vmassol> it would be hte firs ttime  
10:01 <vmassol> we've never done this  
10:01 <vmassol> it means putting a modified htmlcleaner class in WEB-INF/classes  
10:02 <vmassol> we cannot workaround it unfortunately  
10:02 <vmassol> and  
10:02 <vmassol> the other issue  
10:02 <tmortagne> we could deploy a patched htmlcleaner  
10:02 <vmassol> is that I'm almost sure the patch provided by Scott doesn't fix all svg issues  
10:02 <vmassol> tmortagne: on central?  
10:03 <tmortagne> why central ?  
10:03 <vmassol> because it's in commons  
10:03 <tmortagne> pdf export ?  
10:03 <vmassol> so our deps need to be in central  
10:03 <vmassol> yes we could also deploy an xwiki patched version in our remotre repo  
10:03 <vmassol> and exlude the original htmlcleaner in platform-web  
10:04 <tmortagne> no need to exclude, a dependencymanagement will do  
10:04 <vmassol> this is almost the same as poroviding a pathed class in WEB-INF/classes  
10:04 <vmassol> same stragey, differnt impl  
10:04 <vmassol> but again  
10:04 <vmassol> the issue I think is that it won't fix it  
10:04 <vmassol> anyway let me try to patch HC 2.5 now  
10:05 <vmassol> with Scott' patch for 2.7-SNAP  
10:05 <vmassol> I'll also enter in some meeting real soon now….  
10:05 <vmassol> so I might not be able to do this before the afternoon  
10:08 <vmassol> has quit  
10:09 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <sburjan> tmortagne; regarding XE-1347 .. I still get conflicts with Stats pages. I am on the newest 5.2.2-SNAPSHOT  
10:11 <Denis> has quit  
10:11 <tmortagne> sburjan: what is the date of the newest ?  
10:12 <cjd> has quit  
10:12 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <sburjan> tmortagne : I am looking at the conflict of the document Stats.CurrentWeekActivity. The new version if from 2013/12/04 11:11  
10:13 <sburjan> and the current version is 2008/04/18 18:32  
10:13 <tmortagne> taking about XE build date  
10:13 <sburjan> 03-Dec-2013 19:40  
10:14 <tmortagne> http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-statistics-ui/5.3-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-platform-statistics-ui-5.3-20131203.213517-115.pom is wrong actually  
10:14 <tmortagne> it's not the right id  
10:14 <tmortagne> so the issue is not fixed it seems  
10:14 <tmortagne> looking  
10:18 <sburjan> tmortagne: shouldn't you commit on 5.2.x also ?  
10:18 <tmortagne> hmm http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-statistics-ui/5.2-SNAPSHOT/ is very old  
10:18 <tmortagne> looks like it's not been deployed  
10:18 <tmortagne> that's weird  
10:19 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: thanks (about bug 9741)... after adding programming rights to user, it works as expected  
10:20 <tmortagne> ha non it's not the right URL  
10:20 <tmortagne> I forced the deploy on http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-statistics-ui/5.2.2-SNAPSHOT/  
10:20 <tmortagne> you don't need to wait for a new version of XE  
10:20 <tmortagne> sburjan:  
10:21 <sburjan> cool. All I have to do now is to start my test from scratch ?  
10:22 <tmortagne> it's the safer yes  
10:23 <tmortagne> it should get the new version of statistics pom this time  
10:23 <tmortagne> (since it downloads it and it does not come from XE war)  
10:37 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <sburjan> tmortagne: I got no more conflicts while upgrating the main wiki. But I have another issue, I'll have to talk with GD  
10:49 <tmortagne> sburjan: not a single conflict ?  
10:49 <tmortagne> you did not added any user I guess ?  
10:49 <tmortagne> before the upgrade I mean  
10:49 <sburjan> tmortagne: no, I did not add any user  
10:50 <tmortagne> ok otherwise you would get a conflict on XWikiAllGroup at least but this one we can't easily do something about it but the proposed merge keep the current state so it's OK  
10:51 <lucaa> has quit  
10:51 <sburjan> not on the main wiki, on the top menu, I don't have Wiki Index anymore. It looks like a classic XE top menu. I've told gdelhumeau about it  
10:52 <tmortagne> you mean in main wiki ?  
10:52 <sburjan> I don't even have Add Workspace submenu, so there is something clearly wrong.  
10:52 <sburjan> yes, Main wiki  
10:52 <tmortagne> Add Workspace does not exist anymore, it's Add wiki  
10:53 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <gdelhumeau> that is because workspacetemplate does not exist  
10:54 <sburjan> it does. In 4.1.4 you had to install the template workspacetemplate.Install page, which I did. And the I even created a workspace  
10:54 <sburjan> \*then  
10:54 <sburjan> and after installing the workspacetemplate, I had the Add->Workspace button  
10:55 <sburjan> and now after the upgrade I have nothing  
11:04 <gdelhumeau> what do you  have if you put $services.workspace.getWorkspaces() in a velocity macro in a page?  
11:05 <evalica> has quit  
11:05 <j-simard> has quit  
11:05 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <sburjan> gdelhumeau,: let me try  
11:05 <sburjan> also, migrating a subwiki seems to get some UI issues  
11:06 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: I get [org.xwiki.workspace.internal.DefaultWorkspace@87ba97a5]  
11:07 <gdelhumeau> ok  
11:07 <gdelhumeau> and do you have WorkspaceManager.WebHome?  
11:08 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:09 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: I am looking on the main wiki. And yes, I have it. I can also see my workspace  which was created on 4.1.4  
11:09 <sburjan> listed in the LiveTable  
11:10 <gdelhumeau> and what does $services.workspace.getWorkspaceTemplates() return?  
11:10 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: this is a screenshot of my UI after the upgrade. http://postimg.org/image/sg4q9zs73/a668e819/  
11:12 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: it returns []  
11:12 <gdelhumeau> ok, that is the problem  
11:12 <gdelhumeau> can you install the Wiki Manager Application and see the list of the wikis?  
11:13 <sburjan> so basically my old workspacetemplate is not seen as a template after the upgrade ?this is why the UI is not correct  
11:13 <gdelhumeau> I don't know yet  
11:13 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: installing now  
11:15 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: http://postimg.org/image/e5rqfd8br/66ce34e3/  
11:15 <gdelhumeau> that is very very strange  
11:15 <sburjan> yes  
11:16 <sburjan> I can give you access to my instance if you want  
11:19 <gdelhumeau> Yes, thanks!  
11:19 <sburjan> ok, just a second  
11:19 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
11:20 <cjd> is now known as <Guest90822>  
11:24 <gdelhumeau> Ok, XWiki.XWikiServerWorkspacetemplate does not have the WorkspaceManager.WorkspaceClass  
11:24 <gdelhumeau> it doesn't make sense  
11:24 <gdelhumeau> that means workspacestemplate is not considered as a template  
11:26 <sburjan> note that I did not upgrade the template using the DW !  
11:26 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you don't remove or modify that page in your migration or something like this ?  
11:26 <sburjan> so it is the same template as it was in 4.1.4  
11:26 <gdelhumeau> according the history, the descriptor page never had that object  
11:27 <gdelhumeau> \*according to  
11:30 <gdelhumeau> ok, in old Workspaces Application, the WorkspaceClass object was not added to the default template...;  
11:31 <sburjan> bbl, lunch  
11:31 <gdelhumeau> ## Migration introduced in 4.3M1. Workspace templates are now marked as workspaces to diferentiate them between regular wiki templates.  
11:33 <sburjan> maybe migrating from 4.1.4 is considered a more niche case, but it still could happen in the wild  
11:34 <lucaa> has quit  
11:36 <gdelhumeau> but sburjan, if you go in the administration  
11:36 <gdelhumeau> has left #xwiki  
11:36 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <gdelhumeau> in the "Wiki" section, the creation if the workspace template is still proposed  
11:37 <gdelhumeau> si I think that going back to WorkspaceManager.Install will fix the issue  
11:37 <gdelhumeau> I'm trying  
11:37 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: this might overwrite any customization you would have made to the template  
11:38 <tmortagne> i.e. reimport the standard XAR  
11:38 <gdelhumeau> Here the messahe when I go back to WorkspaceManager.Install: http://postimg.org/image/4hrd68cqn/  
11:39 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: let me verify, but I don't think so  
11:39 <gdelhumeau> eddy has introduced the migration of the workspacetemplate for that purpose  
11:39 <gdelhumeau> I guess  
11:39 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: but the migration does not seems to have worked here  
11:40 <tmortagne> wasn't the job of the migration to add an object in the descriptor ?  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> it's 5.2.2  
11:40 <tmortagne> and ?  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> the migration Eddy has written is a line of velocity code in WorkspaceManager.Install  
11:41 <tmortagne> does not sounds like proper migration to me...  
11:41 <gdelhumeau> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/xwiki-platform-5.2.1/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-workspace/xwiki-platform-workspace-ui/src/main/resources/WorkspaceManager/Install.xml#L145  
11:41 <tmortagne> should be automatic in an actual migrator  
11:41 <gdelhumeau> yes, I should add a special treatment on the migration of 5.3  
11:42 <tmortagne> it might be a bit late now  
11:42 <gdelhumeau> it could be for 5.3 final?  
11:42 <tmortagne> that class is not even used anymore in 5.3  
11:42 <tmortagne> don't you use the standard template field in 5.3 ?  
11:43 <gdelhumeau> nope but I shoudl always consider workspacetemplate as a workspace, even if the workspace object is not there  
11:43 <gdelhumeau> sburjan: going back to WorkspaceManager.Install fixed the issue  
11:44 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: I don't understand, there is no such thing as workspace in 5.3, only wikis  
11:44 <gdelhumeau> yes, but my migrator look if a wiki is a workspace or not, and set different settings depending on the case  
11:44 <gdelhumeau> workspace -> only global users  
11:45 <gdelhumeau> not workspace -> local + global users  
11:45 <tmortagne> what does not make sense to me is that workspace was not setting the standard template field...  
11:45 <gdelhumeau> if workspacetemplate is not seen as a workspace, it means that I will migrate it to "local + global users"  
11:45 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: it does  
11:46 <gdelhumeau> in 4.1.4 workspacetemplate was a template, but doesn't have the Workspace object  
11:46 <gdelhumeau> so for the 5.3 migrator, it's a subwiki template  
11:47 <gdelhumeau> that is why  $services.workspace.getWorkspaceTemplates() returns an empty array  
11:47 <tmortagne> I see, a workspace which does not have standard workspace object, nice...  
11:47 <gdelhumeau> and why $services.workspace.getWorkspaces() did not list workspacetemplate  
11:47 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: exactly!  
11:48 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <gdelhumeau> in the migrator, I need to add "if (wiki.id == "workspacetemplate")" and that's it  
11:49 <gdelhumeau> it would be a problem if a user has manually created a subwiki called "workspacetemplate"  
11:50 <tmortagne> yep  
11:50 <gdelhumeau> but it's a very improbable use case  ^^  
11:51 <tmortagne> searching for some page in that wiki would be too expensive ?  
11:51 <vmassol> FTR the patch from Scott doesn't apply in HC 2.5.  
11:52 <vmassol> testing now on 2.7-SNAPSHOT but we'll need to decide if we want to risk this  
11:52 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: looking if template-fetaures is installed to be very very sure?  
11:52 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: yep  
11:53 <vmassol> note that with 2.7 we have issues with CDATA  
11:53 <vmassol> which is why I haven't upgrade HC after 2.5  
11:53 <vmassol> my issues are still open on HC side  
11:53 <vmassol> (progressing but still open)  
11:54 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: the user might have removed some page from the template...  
11:54 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: then it's not a workspace ;)  
11:55 <gdelhumeau> I create a JIRA for it  
11:57 <gdelhumeau> no, I reopen http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9738  
11:57 <DarkKnightCZ> how long is the long cashing policy?  
11:58 <DarkKnightCZ> \*caching  
12:03 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: here is the code  
12:03 <tmortagne> LONG\_CACHE\_DURATION = 30 \* 24 \* 3600 \* 1000L  
12:03 <tmortagne> in milliseconds  
12:03 <tmortagne> and before you ask: SHORT\_CACHE\_DURATION = 1 \* 24 \* 3600 \* 1000L ;)  
12:05 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
12:06 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, so waiting 72 hours isn't better than restarting wiki :)  
12:06 <tmortagne> yep  
12:06 <tmortagne> hmm wait  
12:07 <tmortagne> it's a client side caching policy  
12:07 <tmortagne> I doubt restarting XWiki will change anything  
12:07 <tmortagne> this is what we tell the browser how long it should wait to request again the skinx  
12:08 <tmortagne> so simply cleaning your browser cache should do  
12:08 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, has jsx any special cache?  
12:08 <tmortagne> I don't think so  
12:09 <vmassol> yes browser cache cleaning works fine  
12:14 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, then saving jsx doesnt work for some reason...  
12:25 <vmassol> you sure you're doing a force cache refresh?  
12:45 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: yep  
12:50 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, only ?language=en shows old content, everything else shows actual content, any ideas?  
12:51 <camil7> this still does look like browser cache. sometimes the browser still caches the page (and resources)  you have open even when cleaning the cache  
12:52 <camil7> at least I think it does  
12:52 <vmassol> yep  
12:52 <vmassol> has quit  
12:52 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:53 <DarkKnightCZ> definitelly not client-side cache... browser with no previous access to the wiki, same problem  
12:54 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: back  
12:57 <sburjan> tmortagne: regarding XE-1347 I still get some merge conflicts when upgrading subwikis. There aren't that many  
12:59 <camil7> hm, there is no proxy in front of the servlet container running the xwiki either?  
13:00 <DarkKnightCZ> problem solved, rhino creates persistent cache and uses it if there is any syntax error  
13:00 <DarkKnightCZ> problem is it doesn't show any error  
13:03 <camil7> ah, there is the hidden cache :) ...  
13:25 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
13:32 <gdelhumeau> the next PR is a minor fix  
13:34 <gdelhumeau> bb in 1hour  
13:39 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
13:54 <tmortagne> sburjan: XE-1347 was about main wiki, could you create another one for subwikis  
13:55 <sburjan> tmortagne: ofc. do we plan to fix this for 5.2.2 ?  
13:55 <tmortagne> depends what conflicts we are talking about  
13:55 <sburjan> okay. creating JIRA and putting screenshots with the first 5 conflicts  
13:55 <tmortagne> if it's XWikiAllGroup no I don't think we will fix it in 5.2.2  
13:56 <sburjan> it's that + several others  
13:56 <sburjan> ok, creating issue, creating screenshots. thanks  
14:01 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <tmortagne> sburjan: for screenshots don't forget that what is important is previous vs current  
14:08 <sburjan> tmortagne: thanks  
14:12 <sburjan> tmortagne: problem is that I can't put affected version 5.2.2-SNAP in JIRA. Should I put 5.2.1 ?  
14:14 <msmeria> vmassol: hi  
14:15 <vmassol> hi  
14:15 <msmeria> can you make sure all the translations from l10n for French are included when you release 5.2.2 ?  
14:16 <msmeria> Raluca translated some of them and yet they're not included in the latest snapshots  
14:16 <vmassol> we always import translations before releases  
14:16 <vmassol> so it'll be ok  
14:16 <msmeria> ok. just wanted to make sure  
14:16 <msmeria> thanks  
14:16 <vmassol> ok
